alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:34AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Cherry, northwestern Brown and western Keya Paha Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 732 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Sicangu Village to 8 miles south of Cody. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valentine, Norden, Crookston, Burton, Nets Peak, Steer Creek Campground, North River Trail, Schoolhouse Lake, Sparks, Smith Falls State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 126 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 176 and 217. Highway 97 between mile markers 118 and 141. Highway 83 between mile markers 195 and 222. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Western Cherry
